title: Coronavirus: DOE Response
cleaned_text: The Department of Energy (DOE) is working closely with our workforce, National Laboratories, and communities to combat the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Resources for the DOE Community [COVID-19 Workplace Safety Framework](/covid/articles/covid-19-workplace-safety-framework) This Framework outlines the requirements to protect the health and safety of the workforce for the safe accomplishment of the DOE mission in a COVID-19 environment. [Learn more](/covid/articles/covid-19-workplace-safety-framework) [In Memoriam](/covid/memoriam) The Department of Energy (DOE) is deeply saddened by the passing of our colleagues due to the COVID-19 pandemic. While we reflect on their memories, we also honor their commitment and are grateful for having served alongside them. [Learn more](/covid/memoriam) [Department of Energy (DOE) COVID-19 Hotline](/covid/department-energy-doe-covid-19-hotline) The Department established the DOE COVID-19 Hotline to answer COVID-19 related questions by any Federal or contractor employee, and for the DOE workforce to report potential or confirmed COVID-19. [Learn more](/covid/department-energy-doe-covid-19-hotline) DOE National Initiatives to Battle COVID-19 [] DOE's CTAP provides targeted funding to DOE's National Laboratory system to assist non-DOE entities working to combat the coronavirus pandemic.
